definition: to treat sb with due respect (idiom)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: She could consult with her brother, could receive her sister-in-law on her arrival, and treat her with proper attention;
sentences.chinese: 她遇事能同哥哥商量着辦，嫂子來了能以禮相待。

sentences.english: So how do we wrest back control and start being civil to each other again?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，我們如何奪回控制權，彼此重新開始以禮相待？

sentences.english: Netiquette requires that people should be polite in their exchanges.
sentences.chinese: 網上禮節要求人們以禮相待。

sentences.english: I have made it a rule always to pay respect with respect.
sentences.chinese: 我已把以禮相待作爲一條準則。

sentences.english: Maybe you see someone you don't really like, but you have to be polite.
sentences.chinese: 也許您看到您不太喜歡的人，但又必須以禮相待。

sentences.english: He treated his subordinates with respect.
eg: He treated his subordinates with respect.
It takes strength to be polite to someonewhen that person has been rude to you.
sentences.chinese: 以禮相待那些對你粗暴無禮的人，那需要力量。

sentences.english: It takes strength to do what is right.
sentences.chinese: 以禮相待那些對你粗暴無禮的人，那需要力量。

sentences.english: He was never rude to his parents.
sentences.chinese: 他對爸媽總是以禮相待。

sentences.english: You may also be astonished to find out that they really are.
sentences.chinese: 你可能會驚奇地發現，他們確實值得你以禮相待。

sentences.english: Formality has always  characterized their relationship.
sentences.chinese: 他們之間的關係，有一個特點，就是以禮相待。
